intro: Thrixspermum odoratum, commonly known as the fragrant thrixspermum, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. The plant produces small, round berries that are typically yellow or red when mature. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and aromatic properties, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
